p: COVID-19, a severe acute respiratory viral infection in humans caused by SARS-CoV-2 have an average incubation period of 3 days ( Guan et al., 2020). The most common clinical features of COVID-19 are very similar to other viral pneumonia which include fever, fatigue, cough, shortness of breath, and other complications; organ failure and death were recorded in severe and critical cases ( Figure 2) ( WHO, 2020a, WHO, 2020b). These symptoms are markedly expressed in adults probably due to chronic underlying diseases such as heart diseases, neurodegenerative disorders, diabetes, or hypertension ( Chen et al., 2020). Transmission of the virus among humans occurs when there is a penetration of infected aerosols from respiratory droplets, cough, or sneeze into the lungs via inhalation through the nose or mouth.
